{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which variables are continuous, we need to understand the definition of a continuous variable. According to the documents, a continuous variable is a variable whose value is obtained by measuring and can take on an uncountable set of values. It can take on any value within a range. Based on this definition, we can analyze each potential choice:

A. Height in cms: Height is a continuous variable as it can take on any value within a range.
B. Weight in kg: Weight is also a continuous variable as it can take on any value within a range.
C. Blood groups A, B, ABO: Blood groups are categorical variables, not continuous variables. They represent qualitative categories and cannot take on any value within a range.
D. Age in years and months: Age is a continuous variable as it can take on any value within a range.

Therefore, the answer is C. Blood groups A, B, ABO.", "answer_choice": "C"}
